intro: Actinophloeus schumannii, commonly known as the Schumann's actinophloeus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
